Description.val:
Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) focused mission packages provide the operational commander with capabilities to perform Mine Countermeasures (MCM) operations, a Surface Warfare (SUW) detect-to-engage capability to counter small boat threats, and a Anti-Submarine Warfare (ASW) detect-to-engage capability to counter enemy submarines. A Mission Package (MP) is a combination of warfare Mission Modules (MM) with specialized crew, support equipment, and vehicles, including embarked manned helicopters and unmanned aircraft and maritime systems. MM are packaged in a modular fashion so that they can be quickly swapped in and out pier side on any LCS platform. 

The Common Mission Modules Equipment line funds the procurement of MCM and SUW MP support containers and equipment that is common across the mission packages (Mission Package Computing Environment (MPCE), Technology Refresh of the Multi-Vehicle Communications System (MVCS), and Training Equipment).   

This line (OPN 1600) by itself or support containers by themselves do not comprise a MP and are deployable only as part of a Mission Module (MM). A MM is deployable and capable of meeting its focused mission requirements on an LCS only when it includes the full complement of Common Mission Modules Equipment combined with all the required mission systems.  

Other Related Budgets: BLIs: OPN 1601, OPN 1602, OPN 1603, OPN 4248, OPN 2622, OPN 2624, WPN 4221, WPN 4225, RDT&E 0603596N, SCN 2127

[P40A / LM008 - MPCE]: Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS)- Based Common Computing environment will support legacy Mission Package (MP) Command & Control (C2) applications and transition to Modular Open Systems Approach (MOSA) & Navy Open Architecture Computing Environment (OACE). It also provides a common computing environment to support the execution of Mission Package Application Software (MPAS), the shipboard tactical software associated with each mission package that enables execution of its focused mission.  Includes installation and checkout on-board the seaframe.  In order to support the MPCE Sonar Signal Processing of the Escort Mission Module (EMM), the MPCE needs to be augmented to provide additional processing capabilities.  This includes procurement of MPCE Sonar Signal Process equipment racks. These equipment racks will be co-located with the MPCE processing racks.  In addition, Mission Package Portable Control Stations (MPPCS) are required to support pre-deployment checkouts, to support shore-based and vessels of opportunity operations of mission packages and off-board vehicles.

[P40A / LM012 - TRAINING EQUIPMENT]: Procurement of LCS Mission Module training systems to train LCS crews in the safe and effective use of assigned equipment at LCS Training Facilities (LTF) located in San Diego and Mayport.  
    
    LTF includes tactical watch team training using Common Mission Package Trainer (CMPT) integrated with seaframe Combat Management System (CMS) trainers, a replication of LCS mission bays where LCS MM training systems are moved in and out of the Launch and Recovery (L&R) footprint to train all crews in the safe movement of systems, and revalidate key maintenance skills in the confined mission bay environment.  
    
    Integrated Tactical Training (ITT) uses the CMPT trainer, with two CMPTs delivered to LCS-1 ITT trainer and LCS-2 ITT trainer in San Diego. CMPT#3 for LCS-1 ITT trainer in Mayport installed in FY2018 and commenced operations in FY 2018. CMPT#4 procured in FY 2018 to support second San Diego LCS-2 trainer for installation in FY 2019. CMPT#5 procurement is in FY 2019 to support third San Diego LCS-2 trainer for installation in FY 2020.  CMPT#6 procurement is in FY 2020 to support third Mayport LCS-1 trainer for installation in FY 2021.  MCM and SUW integrated team training commenced at San Diego in FY 2012 and commenced for SUW only in Mayport in FY 2018. MCM ITT functions with USV and UUV capability is procured in FY 2019 for planned delivery in Mayport by FY 2021.  ASW ITT capability procurement is planned for FY 2021 for delivery into the ITTs in FY 2023. CMPTs qualify individuals in a team environment (Train to Qualify) and are also used to certify watch teams (Train to Certify) during off hull periods at LTF. 
    
Each mission area will be delivering training systems as follows:  
    
MCM: All unmanned vehicles, sensors, and systems in support containers to demonstrate Launch & Recovery (L&R) and maintenance tasks. An Immersive Virtual Shipboard Environment (IVSE) (virtual reality) allow sailors to learn and demonstrate crane operator and system remote operations L&R team coordination.  Procurements are aligned to with fleet system deliveries and support formal training that has commenced in San Diego and Mayport. 
    
SUW: A MK-46 gun in barbette on a multi-function adapter demonstrates GMM critical maintenance and ammunition loading tasks. MSM AEL equipment is used to support Visit Board Search and Seizure (VBSS) certification and exercise related shipboard evolutions such as "detainee handling." Surface-to-Surface Missile Module (SSMM) module components are used to demonstrate onload tasks. Mission Package Training System (MPTS) is a NAWC TSD PORTS Architecture based training system used in training SUW operators and maintaining gun and missile operator proficiency. Procurements are for incremental system delivery and support formal training that will commence in San Diego and Mayport in FY 2022.
    
ASW: IVSE demonstrates ASW system L&R tasks. Procurements support formal training that will commence in San Diego and Mayport in FY 2022. 
    
The LCS MM program is also procuring training systems for installation at other shore locations as follows:
    
  
Fleet ASW Training Center San Diego, CA: Sonar Technician (STG) pipeline training at Pt Loma, CA. Operator training system for AN/SQS-62 operator training using CMPT- like environment.  Course will include an AN/SQS-62 maintenance trainer for maintenance and deploy/retrieve tasks.  Procurements in FY 2021 support formal training that will commence in FY2023.

[P40A / COMMON MISSION PACKAGE TRAINER (CMPT)]: CMPT is procured from AAC under SBIR Phase III contract, and when delivered is integrated with ship combat management system (CMS) trainers capable of being connected to the Navy Cooperative Training Environment (NCTE) for participation in Navy and Joint synthetic training events at the LCS Training Facilities in each home port. A total of 6 are required: 3 in San Diego and 3 in Mayport. The first CMPT was procured using RDT&E.  A CMPT consists of a production Mission Package Computing Environment (MPCE) using one of three mission area Mission Package Application Software (MPAS) and integrated with visualization software (common with ship CMS trainer), models and simulations to stimulate tactical MPAS, scenario generator, and instructor control software. Mission area additions (SUW: GUID, and ASW: Escort Mission Module (EMM) processing), and IP communications capability for watchstanders are included.

[P40A / LM015 - CONTAINERS (SHIPPING & SUPPORT)]: Each MP variant uses a base Support Container (SC) which is an International Organization for Standardization (ISO) compliant shipping container, and comes in two variants: Type I and Type II. The Type I container is a 20-foot ISO container with nominal dimensions of 20' x 8' x 8'. The Type II container is a 10-foot ISO container with nominal dimensions of 10' x 8' x 8'. In both cases the base SC is constructed of high strength steel or aluminum to reduce the overall weight and features a number of standard configuration items.  Mission systems fit inside standard ten- or twenty-foot ISO SCs, or on ISO compliant flat racks and vehicle cradles. The LCS MP zones inside each seaframe mission bay are configured to accommodate the SCs.

[P40A / MCM SUPPORT CONTAINER]: Unit price for the MCM Support Containers is an average cost that does not reflect the actual cost of each container.  Individual containers for each of the different MCM mission systems have unique requirements and vary in cost.

[P40A / LM016 - MVCS]: The Multiple Vehicle Communications System (MVCS) provides the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS) Mission Modules with the capability to simultaneously communicate with multiple Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs) and surfaced Unmanned Underwater Vehicles (UUVs) by providing a common data link and network communication services.  These services include link establishment, link management, communications fail-safes, Emissions Control (EMCON) handling, data routing and protection, packet shaping, Priority of Service (PoS), and automated communications system configuration.  MVCS establishes a common interface for these services in the form of hardware and message definitions to maximize the usefulness of limited radio equipment onboard the LCS seaframe.

[P40A / Offboard OTH Communications]: The Multi-Vehicle Communications System (MVCS) is a communications management system that provides common Line of Sight (LOS), Over the Horizon (OTH), and satellite communications capabilities for simultaneous sensor data transfer and vehicle control of multiple Littoral Combat Ships (LCS) Mission Module Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USV) and Unmanned Underwater Vehicles (UUVs).  MVCS is an open architected communications system that can be adapted to support any radio system.  This funds procurement and delivery of shipboard and small craft radios and to provide OTH capabilities needed by the Mine Countermeasures (MCM) Mission Package.

[P40A / LM900 - CONSULTING SERVICES]: Provides program management support, engineering and technical support, studies, analysis and evaluation on mission package systems.

Justification.val: FY 2021 funding in LM008 (MPCE) is to support the continued technology refresh of the MPCE (AN/SYK-31) and MPCE Sonar Signal Processing racks. LM012 funds the technology refresh of CMPTs and ASW training equipment to support the outfitting of the LCS Training Facility (LTF) in San Diego, CA/Mayport, FL to support training of Independence/Freedom variant crews. LM015 support procurement of MCM Support Containers required to outfit LCS MCM Divisional Ships. LM016 (MVCS) supports procurement of Offboard Communication equipment required for Over the Horizon communication capabilities.  OTH being incorporated and fielded as part of MVCS Technology Refresh.

Name.@footnote: The MPCE Sonar Signal Processing hardware is provided as adjunct hardware to the Mission Package Computing Environment (MPCE) and will be fielded to meet in yard need dates for LCS 21 - LCS 28. It requires periodic upgrades to remain effective and to pace threats. To achieve this, will insert maturing ASW technologies and addressing hardware obsolescence in incremental upgrades every four years to the production program via the AxB development process.
Technical Training Equipment that is integrated with Ship Combat Management System to conduct stand-alone MP team training and integrated LCS Team training.
Procurement of ECP's, Tech Refresh, and Modernization to keep CMPT and MPTS current with delivered baseline.

Procurement of MCM components located in an LCS mission bay to replicate the afloat environment as required to support individual qualification and team certification associated with routine and corrective system maintenance in a constrained environment, transportation in the mission bay, pre- / post- operation system maintenance; system launch and recovery.  MCM Mission Bay Training includes the following hardware components: AQS-20 Part Task Trainer (PTT), MHU-191 Adapter, AQS-20 Deploy and Retrieve PTT, Knifefish UUV Launch and Recovery Virtual Trainer, Knifefish PTT, USV LHR Virtual Trainer, Minesweeping PDS PTT, USV PTT, and MCM Training Support Containers.
